value: It started as a school project for Bob Heft’s junior-year history class, and it only earned a B- in 1958. His design had 50 stars even though Alaska and Hawaii weren’t states yet. Heft figured the two would earn statehood soon and showed the government his design. After President Dwight D. Eisenhower called to say his design was approved, Heft’s teacher changed his grade to an A.
The mother spends six months so devoted to protecting the eggs that she doesn’t eat. The babies are the size of a grain of rice when they’re born.

name: Quote of the Day
value: “You add try and umph… see what you come up with.”  -Anonymous

name: Quote of the Day
value: “Be who you are and say what you feel because those who mind don’t matter and those who matter don’t mind.”  -Dr. Suess

name: Did you ever wonder…
value: How is it possible to have a “civil” war?

name: Did you ever wonder…
value: Why do we sing “Take me out to the ball game” when we’re already there?

name: Did you ever wonder…
value: If man evolved from monkeys and apes, why do we still have monkeys and apes?

name: Did you ever wonder…
value: Why doesn’t Tarzan have a beard?

name: Did you ever wonder…
value: What little birdies see when they get knocked unconscious?

name: Did you ever wonder…
value: Why does sour cream have an expiration date?

name: Did you ever wonder…
value: Why do you get on a bus or a train but get into a car?

name: Did you ever wonder…
value: Is a hot car cool or is a cool car hot?

name: Did you ever wonder…
value: How come abbreviated is such a long word?

name: Did you ever wonder…
value: Why doesn’t glue stick to the inside of the bottle?
